commentBody: Interesting, no mention of the 1% that is otherwise so prevalent in the comments.  Just imagine the comments if a CEO moves from one Fortune 100 company to another and received that kind of money, very few would discuss the pros and cons  of the move and most would be disgusted with the compensation.

replies.commentBody:
@Jube, Kevin Durant makes the money he does because he does something at a consistent, elite level, that most people on this planet cannot do and the market reflects that. His compensation, comes at the expense of 1%er franchise owners and TV networks. One can have a debate about ticket prices.

A good portion of CEO's get the outrageous compensation they do, not as a result of their rarefied skills being valued by the market but because they are a bunch of theives, with the help of a board of syncophants, often at the expense of their workers and shareholders.
